alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Dane; Dodge; Fond du Lac; Green Lake; Iowa; Marquette; Sauk (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 18 at 6:35PM CST until February 18 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM CST FOR GREEN LAKE...WESTERN FOND DU LAC...NORTHEASTERN IOWA...COLUMBIA... NORTHWESTERN DANE...EAST CENTRAL MARQUETTE...SAUK AND NORTHWESTERN DODGE COUNTIES... At 634 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Brandon to near Sauk City, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 40 mph. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstates 90. Locations impacted include... Western Madison, Middleton, Beaver Dam, Waunakee, Baraboo, Waupun, Ripon, Windsor, Berlin, Columbus, Prairie Du Sac, Sauk City, Lake Wisconsin, Deforest, Cross Plains, Lodi, Poynette, Randolph, Fall River and Mazomanie. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.

area.areaDesc: Columbia; Dane; Dodge; Fond du Lac; Green Lake; Iowa; Marquette; Sauk
